text:
I'm leading an R&D effort right now to figure out what tech stack we'd need for API server.

It would be nice if I get to use Python and Tornado as they are both my favorites :)

Also, does this library have mailing list and IRC? I only saw the G+ page.
title: Have you guys heard anyone using oauthlib and Tornado?
Have you guys heard anyone using oauthlib and Tornado?

text:
I am not aware of any but that doesn't mean there aren't. A search on pypy and github/bitbucket might help.

If you would be interested in starting a Tornado OAuthLib integration similar to what @lepture is doing with [flask-oauthlib](https://github.com/lepture/flask-oauthlib) and @synasius is doing with [django-oauth-toolkit](https://github.com/evonove/django-oauth-toolkit) I'd be happy to help when time allows.

Closest thing to mailing list would be GitHub issues. Feel free to use issues to ask questions or post on the G+ page though. 

We do have IRC #oauthlib  on Freenode which I try to frequent during working hours CEST.
Thanks for the pointers again. Using flask-oauthlib as example is a good idea.
@ib-lundgren why not close this issue? I think it is solved.
